Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black; from top, dotted square and billet pattern in added white and added red; two white bands; white pomegranates with two brown circles on each; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lower torso, legs and red thighs of possibly male figure to left.
Curator's comments: Contrary to the norm where male flesh is usually coloured brown to red, the flesh on this cup is not coloured but depicted in outline, a manner of decorating flesh usually reserved for female figures.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 278, no. 754, pl. III)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0734) (phase 2)
